values:
My Loldee's ill :( It not good.

At the mo, she's trying to get to sleep, which I hope she does. She can't have had more than a few hours of it in the last 2 days.

Trying my bestest to make her feel better wi medicines and doing as much as i can so nothing needs done by her, but I dunno if it's helping. Got annoyed about stuff the other day, not pissed off, just annoyed and didn't deal with it in the best way. I clammed up like I sometimes do. Plus I was knackered from work and didn't think that if I did talk, it'd make much sense or come out the right way.

Trouble is, not talking about it made Loldee paranoid. 'Argh!' says my befuddled head.

All I can say is this...Laura is the greatest person on this planet and probably the best in the universe (known and unknown). She's the love of my life and the most beautiful, caring, loving, amazing person I know. Everyone else knows this and I'll spend as long as it takes to convince the girl in question that all these things are true.

Everyone that's on LJ that knows her, knows this to be true.

There's many a time I don't feel worthy to be with such a person and maybe I'm not.

I'm just glad I am.

I am useless. Let there be know doubt regarding that particular matter. I've always thought so and still do. I've just never seemed to know the point to my life. I've had aspirations of being a racing driver. That faded to car designer. Then that faded to writing about cars. I suppose it's realising what's realistic, with a hint, maybe a titchy tad of optimism thrown in.

I realised that for a lot of my life I've been a complete outsider. Never really being liked by many people and being seen as an easy target for every joke and jibe anyone, anywhere could muster. I went through every school day enduring wave upon wave of idiot speak from so called better than I's saying I looked funny or stupid or wrong or that my clothes were too cheap or that I said the wrong thing at the wrong time in the wrong place. Every move I made seemed to be under their incredibally insightful scrutiny. That, I suppose is why I am the neurotic, paranoid, inferiority complexed, twat I am today and probably why people still think I'm just not right (probably my neurotic paranoia creeping in).

Because of all the shit that went on at school, I was, of course, never that great at making my feelings felt toward people, especially girls. I was always that dumb unrequited love fool, that you hear about in cheesy songs and that if I were a character in happy 80's film, I would always win out to get the girl. But I never did. I just didn't have a clue. I'd sometimes be able to tell a girl I liked her, then to be crushed by the news that she could only ever see me as a friend or that she didn't want to break my heart by going out with me and breaking up, but did so anyway by never giving me a chance in the first place.

It went that way at uni too (Yes, this is all woe and turmoil and saddness and crap like that, but this is lj, so ha). I moved away from home a year and a bit into my 1st course and that helped my confidence a bit. I went out a lot, but wasn't exactly confident or very talkative. Hell, I didn't even dance (not that I really can anyway). Then about a year in, something miraculous happened, I actually started to pull. Oh joy, miracle upon miracle. Yeah, of course. But then I was hung up on a girl that didn't want to know. 'Oh dear', I hear you cry.

Fast forward a bit, to a year and a half ago. I meet Laura. At first it was all a bit random, up in the air, not to important kinda stuff, but then, rather quickly I threw myself into it and was scared it was going to implode under the usual strain of me saying 'I love you' too soon. But this time, the girl in question said 'I love you' back.

I was so amazed and shocked. A girl. A girl I actually had fallen for felt the same way. About me(!) It was scary but such a massive thing in my life to have found her. I mean. Up to that point I had never really been in a proper relationship. I hadn't even really properly gone out with anyone and then suddenly, I'd found the girl I had always wanted to be with. I didn't even really know her before hand. I always assumed I'd end up being friends with a girl first and then we'd go out, etc, etc, but it didn't happen like that at all. I met the girl of my dreams randomly, at the union for heaven sakes.

Then the inevitable, I started getting all stupid and 'I'm not worthy' and 'I don't deserve you' and this gave way to a real relationship, cause I got past that, eventually, kind of, well not really I suppose. But she stayed and put up with me being a pratt (she still does). I mean, I know that she is the best. Cheesy I know, but it's true. No one else will ever get a look in.

But now she's the one that says these things. I know she just posted how she feels about herself and that no one was to reply to it, so I haven't, I've just posted in my own lj. The fact is that I've done everything I can to tell her how I feel and how much I care about her. How wonderful I know she is and most of all how fucking gorgeous she is...fact! And I will keep on telling her this forever and ever.

I mean, I reckon I am so utterly, stupidly, lucky to be with a girl like Laura. She always has something interesting to say, she always makes me smile (even if I don't want to), she's smart enough to have a conversation with (even though she doesn't think so, she does know a lot of random info and stuff I could never hope to know), she bounces, she can wiggle her nose, but most of all, topping everything I just said, she's Laura Elizabeth Nicholson and I love her.

I love Paisley, I really do. From the lovely architecture (some of it is amazing if you look past the crappy 60's, 70's and 80's designed shop fronts), the closeness to Glasgow and of course the home of one of the most famous pattern type things ever.

One thing I do hate though is Paisley neds. Sure, most them are a joke and won't live till they're 40 but they are the most horrible, idiotic, ignorant, bunch of vagrants that has ever been crapped out of the evolutionary arsehole. From they're stupid swagger and lack of grasping the english language in it's entirety to their rather flammable dress sense. They are quite simply, scum.

Why, you may ask am I ranting about this and also putting it in my 1st lj entry since June? Basically because a group of said neds kicked the crap out of me last night without reason or motive. They basically had a 'what ye saein?' comment and started on me.

I mean they said "Ho, you a gay boy?" and I without thinking (which I should have given the missing-link brain power of these people) said "No are you?" And of course this was adequate provocation for what they did to me. I'm sure in the the wonderful world of Ned-dom, this is the most insulting and fight-start-worthy of responses. But in the real world, that's bullshit.

I've got a burst lip from getting kneed in the mouth and am generally rather sore from them repeatedly kicking me when I was down (how sporting). It's happened before to me, although I did more taunting that time. It resulted in not huge black eye, so not even as severe as this time.

It's just the fact that we have to put up with this. Everywhere in the UK and I'm sure other countries have neds. It's an epidemic and one that has to be stopped somehow. You can't have useless, idiotic, wasters who make people's lives and places they call home a miserable place to inhabit. The police should charge people for the fact they are a ned. Making nedism illegal would be a step in the correct direction.

As has been said many a time by people I know and also by myself, the best use for neds is in the front line at Iraq or some other armed conflict. That should make a dent in their burberry worshiping nation.

Slander!
and have been secretly doing it!
once kept locked up in their basement for eight months.
once took into a changing room for some "fun"!
has an invisible friend. They're dating.
runs a secret pornography ring. and are regular models.
knows *just* how long to hold them down for.

Enter your username to dish the dirt on your friends!

first entry so here goes...

tis my first of two days off from work today which sucks as i'll be workin 7 days straight when I go back at the weekend :( But anyway, Laura's parents are up to see the event that is Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban. I must confess I used to think all things Potter were distinctly crap, but after seeing the first two movies, it's not bad. Not great, but not bad.

I also cut back on my hair today. It's now short not long. Laura's still goin on about how cute my stupid stubbly beard is, but I'm still undetermined. Can't be bothered shaving much though, so it's here to stay, for the moment.

At the mo, Laura is playing my classic Sega Mega Drive and we're goin out for tea. That usually happens when Laura's parents come over, not that Laura's not a good cook...i better stop before this hole gets any deeper.

I'm still wanting to update my website that i have. it's been languishing in the same configuration for over 3 years now and it's rather sad. i mean it's gotten to the point where porn sites are advertising in my guestbook, which I have to keep deleting as my site is a clean and non-porn type place, although i still have that embarrassing 'celebrity babes' page. I was a fool when I was 20(!)

Anyway, just in case any of you want to view it, the address is <href> http://www.katnip.freeserve.co.uk/ </href> my dad came up with that address. I'll try to find the time and a way to update it in the next few weeks.
